title: Linking fails in some cases on windows, "undefined reference to `hypot'"
body:
Under Windows 10 64bits, with Rustc V 1.11.0 Windows (GNU ABI ) (9b21dcd6a 2016-08-15) when compiling  with .cmd file (cargo build in it) , I got this error
If  I do `Cargo build` in MSys2 Shell, threre is no errors.

**PATH variable**

> C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\bin; D:\Applications\Rust stable GNU 1.11\bin

**Error**

```
> error: linking with `gcc` failed: exit code: 1
> note: "gcc" "-Wl,--enable-long-section-names" "-fno-use-linker-plugin" "-Wl,--nxcompat" "-nostdlib" "-m64" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\crt2.o" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rsbegin.o" "-L" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib" "D:\\Applications\\msys64\\home\\lemoussel\\RUST\\rusty_data-structures\\target\\debug\\rusty_data_structures.0.o" "-o" "D:\\Applications\\msys64\\home\\lemoussel\\RUST\\rusty_data-structures\\target\\debug\\rusty_data_structures.exe" "-Wl,--gc-sections" "-nodefaultlibs" "-L" "D:\\Applications\\msys64\\home\\lemoussel\\RUST\\rusty_data-structures\\target\\debug" "-L" "D:\\Applications\\msys64\\home\\lemoussel\\RUST\\rusty_data-structures\\target\\debug\\deps" "-L" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib" "-Wl,-Bstatic" "-Wl,-Bdynamic" "D:\\Applications\\msys64\\home\\lemoussel\\RUST\\rusty_data-structures\\target\\debug\\deps\\liblibrusty_data_structures-e6704dcc9b7cb36a.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libstd-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libpanic_unwind-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libunwind-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\librand-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libcollections-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\librustc_unicode-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\liblibc-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\liballoc-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\liballoc_system-39b92f95.rlib" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libcore-39b92f95.rlib" "-l" "ws2_32" "-l" "userenv" "-l" "shell32" "-l" "advapi32" "-l" "gcc_eh" "-l" "compiler-rt" "-lmingwex" "-lmingw32" "-lgcc" "-lmsvcrt" "-luser32" "-lkernel32" "D:\\Applications\\Rust stable GNU 1.11\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rsend.o"
> note: D:\Applications\Rust stable GNU 1.11\lib\rustlib\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\lib\crt2.o:crtexe.c:(.text+0x26f): undefined reference to `_set_invalid_parameter_handler'
> D:\Applications\Rust stable GNU 1.11\lib\rustlib\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\lib\libstd-39b92f95.rlib(std-39b92f95.0.o):(.text+0xc92): undefined reference to `nextafter'
> D:\Applications\Rust stable GNU 1.11\lib\rustlib\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\lib\libstd-39b92f95.rlib(std-39b92f95.0.o):(.text+0xce2): undefined reference to `hypot'
```
